mwr_raw2l1.measurement package

Submodules

mwr_raw2l1.measurement.measurement module

class Measurement[source]

Bases: object

classmethod from_attex(read_in_data)[source]
classmethod from_radiometrics(readin_data)[source]
classmethod from_rpg(readin_data)[source]

constructor for data read in from RPG instruments.

Auxiliary data are merged to time grid of MWR data. Scanning MWR data are returned as time series (no ele dim)

Parameters

readin_data – dictionary with list of instances for each RPG read-in class (keys correspond to filetype)

Returns

an instance of the Measurement class with observations filled to self.data

run(conf_inst=None)[source]
set_coord(conf_inst, primary_src='data', delta_lat=0.01, delta_lon=0.02, delta_altitude=10)[source]

(re)set coordinate variables (lat, lon, altitude) in self.data from datafile input and configuration

If both are available the method checks consistency between coordinates in datafile and configuration.

Parameters

  • conf_inst – configuration dictionary for instrument containing keys station_latitude, station_longitude and station_altitude. If set to None, coordinates are taken from datafile without any checks and an error is raised if any of lat, lon or altitude is missing in data.

  • primary_src (optional {'data', 'config'}) – specifies which source takes precedence. Defaults to ‘data’

  • delta_lat (optional) – maximum allowed difference between latitude in config and in datafile in degrees. Defaults to 0.01.

  • delta_lon (optional) – maximum allowed difference between longitude in config and in datafile in degrees. Defaults to 0.02.

  • delta_altitude (optional) – maximum allowed difference between altitude in config and in datafile in meters. Defaults to 10.

set_statusflag()[source]

set statusflag from data

mwr_raw2l1.measurement.measurement_helpers module

drop_duplicates(ds, dim)[source]

drop duplicates from all data in ds for duplicates in dimension vector

Parameters

  • ds – xarray.Dataset or xarray.DataArray containing the data

  • dim – string indicating the dimension name to check for duplicates

Returns

ds with unique dimension vector

make_dataset(data, dims, vars, vars_opt=None, multidim_vars=None, time_vector=None)[source]

generate a xarray.Dataset from ‘data’ dictionary using the dimensions and variables specified

Parameters

  • data – dictionary containing the data. If set to None or empty a placeholder dataset with all-NaN time series (except variable IRT, which is 2d) is returned. If set to None or empty time_vector must be specified.

  • dims – list of keys that are a dimension (must correspond to the order of dimensions in data)

  • vars – list of keys that are data variables (dimensions don’t need to be specified again)

  • vars_opt (optional) – list of keys that are optional data variables (added as 1-d series of NaN if not in ‘data’)

  • multidim_vars (optional) – dictionary of variables with more than time dimension. Variable name as key, number of dimensions as values. This argument will be ignored as long as the variable is present in dataset

  • time_vector (optional) – numpy.ndarray of numpy.datetime64 to take as time dimension for generating all-NaN datasets. This argument will be ignored as long as data is not None or empty

Returns

xarray.Dataset

mwr_raw2l1.measurement.rpg_helpers module

merge_brt_blb(all_data)[source]

merge brt (zenith MWR) and blb (scanning MWR) observations from an RPG instrument

Parameters

all_data – dictionary with a xarray.Dataset attached to each key (output of to_datasets())

to_datasets(data, dims, vars, vars_opt)[source]

generate unique xarray.Dataset for each type of obs in ‘data’ using dimensions and variables specified

Parameters

  • data – dictionary of lists containing the obs (obs: a dictionary of variable names and values) for different source files of same type. The dictionary keys correspond to the type of observations (e.g. brt, blb, …)

  • dims – list of keys that are a dimension (must correspond to the order of dimensions in data)

  • vars – list of keys that are data variables (dimensions don’t need to be specified again)

  • vars_opt – list of keys that are optional data variables (added as 1-dim series of NaN if missing in ‘data’)

Returns

dictionary with one xarray.Dataset for each key. It contains one item for each key in data

mwr_raw2l1.measurement.scan_transform module

collection of functions for transforming a scanning observation with elevation dim to a flat time series

scan_endtime_to_time(endtime, n_angles, time_per_angle=17)[source]

RPG scan files only have one timestamp per scan. This function returns the approximate timestamp for the observation at each angle

Parameters

  • endtime (numpy.ndarray of numpy.datetime64 or single datetime.datetime object) – Corresponds ot the single timestamp saved with each angle scan. Assumed as the end time of the scan

  • n_angles – number of angles per scan.

  • time_per_angle – total time for scanning one angle including integration time and the time for moving the mirror. Indicated in seconds. The default is 17.

Returns

np.array of datetime.datetime objects. list of timestamps (end of integration) for each observed angle

Return type

time

scan_to_timeseries(blb, *args, **kwargs)[source]

Transform scanning datasete to time series of Tb spectra and temperatures flattening the elevation dimension.

The time vector of each elevation in scan comes from scan_endtime_to_time inferring scan duration from aux data

Parameters

  • blb – xarray.Dataset of the scan observations (BLB)

  • *args – Auxiliary observations (HKD, BRT) as xarray.Dataset passed on to scan_endtime_to_time()

  • **kwargs – Auxiliary observations (HKD, BRT) as xarray.Dataset passed on to scan_endtime_to_time()

Returns

blb with elevation-dimension transformed to time series

scan_to_timeseries_from_dict(data, *args, **kwargs)[source]

transform scans to time series of spectra and temperatures starting from dict.

Not routinely used anymore. More hard coding than for scan_to_timeseries

Parameters

  • data – dictioinary containing the scan observations (BLB)

  • *args – Auxiliary observations

  • **kwargs – Auxiliary observations

scantime_from_aux(blb, hkd=None, brt=None)[source]

determine time of each elevation in scan using scan_endtime_to_time() inferring scan duration from aux data

If none of the optional arguments is provided default scan duration form scan_endtime_to_time() is used

Parameters

  • blb – xarray.Dataset of the scan observations

  • hkd (optional) – xarray.Dataset of housekeeping data

  • brt (optional) – xarray.Dataset of zenith observation data

Returns

vector of timestamps (end of integration) for each observed angle as numpy.ndarray of :class`datetime.datetime` objects
